alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Treutlen; Wheeler (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 05 at 6:47AM EDT until April 05 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Ocmulgee River at Abbeville affecting Telfair, Dodge and Wilcox Counties. Ocmulgee River near Lumber City affecting Telfair, Montgomery and Wheeler Counties. Oconee River near Mount Vernon affecting Treutlen, Montgomery and Wheeler Counties. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Abbeville, Lumber City... Minor flooding is forecast. For the Oconee River Basin...including Mount Vernon...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and is forecast. * WHERE...Oconee River near Mount Vernon. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 16 feet, Flood Stage is reached. Minor flooding begins in the woodlands...pastures and natural flood plain along the river upstream and downstream from the gage on U.S. Highway 280. Flood waters reach the top of a boat ramp by the bridge on the Wheeler County side of the River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 16.3 feet and slowly falling. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 10.9 feet Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 16 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
